message.content:
cs.AR, cs.PF, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper focuses on optimizing parallelism on heterogeneous many-core architectures, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
- cs.PF (Performance): The paper proposes a performance model to estimate the resulting performance of the target application under a given resource partition and task granularity configuration, which is a key aspect of performance optimization.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper deals with parallel applications and heterogeneous many-core architectures, which are relevant topics in this sub-category.
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper proposes an automatic approach to derive a good solution for hardware resource partition and task granularity for task-based parallel applications, which involves software engineering techniques.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a machine learning-based approach to automatically learn a performance model, which is a relevant topic in this sub-category.
